tum.dss.thesis.lsframework

Class AbstractMechanism

  • java.lang.Object
    • tum.dss.thesis.lsframework.AbstractMechanism
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MechanismInterface
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Mechanism

    public abstract class AbstractMechanism
extends Object
implements MechanismInterface
    Class with various static methods to run a single iteration of the LS framework step by step.
    Author:
    Florian Stallmann

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected boolean add_packing_property_solutions
      Mechanism config: add valid solutions due to packing property
      int counter
      Counting the calls on runMechanism (used as id for filenames)
      protected int cut
      Ellipsoid config: cut
      MechanismDataInterface data
      Original data with players, valuations and items/subsets
      protected boolean data_imported
      Save if data is already imported to ellipsoid data
      PrimalDecompositionInterface decomp
      Primal decomposition model
      EllipsoidMethodData ell_data
      Data for ellipsoid method

      Ellipsoid config: epsilon

      Identifier of the mechanism (used as folder name)

      Gurobi LP Relaxation model

      Save if LP is already solved
      protected boolean min_deviation
      Mechanism config: minimize deviation when solving the decomposition
      protected int n
      Ellipsoid config: interations
      SeparationOracleInterface oracle
      Separation oracle
      protected double overwrite_int_gap
      Mechanism config: overwrite original integrality gap, default 0 will ask the oracle for its gap
      protected double radius
      Ellipsoid config: radius
      protected boolean stop_if_feasible
      Mechanism config: stop if decomposition feasible
      protected int type_of_initial_center
      Mechanism config: changes initial center, default 0 is original center proposed by paper
      protected boolean use_objective_as_gamma
      Mechanism config: use objective value instead of 1 as gamma for deep cut

      • setStopIfFeasible

        public void setStopIfFeasible(boolean feas)
        Description copied from interface: MechanismInterface
        Sets whether or not the ellipsoid method should stop as soon as decomposition is feasible.
        Specified by:
        setStopIfFeasible in interface MechanismInterface
        Parameters:
        feas - true if feasibility of primal will end ellipsoid.

      • setManualIntegerSolutions

        public void setManualIntegerSolutions(boolean add)
        Description copied from interface: MechanismInterface
        Sets if all integer solutions that are valid due to the packing property should be added before running the ellipsoid method.

        The method will also add the zero vector which is always a valid solution. The iteration in which the solution were found will be set to 0.

        Specified by:
        setManualIntegerSolutions in interface MechanismInterface
        Parameters:
        add - true if integer solutions should be added manually.

      • setObjectiveAsGamma

        public void setObjectiveAsGamma(boolean deep_gamma)
        Description copied from interface: MechanismInterface
        Sets if the objective value should be used as gamma value for the deep cut.

        The original paper suggests to use 1 as gamma value for objective cuts. This method can restore the originally proposed behavior for the deep cut

        Specified by:
        setObjectiveAsGamma in interface MechanismInterface
        Parameters:
        deep_gamma - true if objective value should be used as gamma.

      • setInitialCenter

        public void setInitialCenter(int center_type)
        Description copied from interface: MechanismInterface
        Set another initial center than the originally proposed one.

        The original paper suggests to use wi,S=0 and z=1 as center. This method allows to change the center by giving a type. The following types are available:

        • 0: original center as defined above
        • 1: vector consisting of 0s
        • 2: vector consisting of 1s
        Specified by:
        setInitialCenter in interface MechanismInterface
        Parameters:
        center_type - type of center vector as defined above.

      • setOverwriteGap

        public void setOverwriteGap(double int_gap)
        Description copied from interface: MechanismInterface
        Overwrite the integrality gap defined by the oracle to a custom value.

        By default the primal decomposition is solved using the integrality gap returned by the separation oracle. This method can overwrite the gap to any value. Setting it to 0 will use the original gap again.

        Specified by:
        setOverwriteGap in interface MechanismInterface
        Parameters:
        int_gap - integrality gap used for decomposition.

      • setMinimizeDeviation

        public void setMinimizeDeviation(boolean decomp_min_dev)
        Description copied from interface: MechanismInterface
        Set if the decomposition should take the absolute deviation into account.

        This will switch to another primal decomposition class with a modified objective function which will minimize the absolute deviation from the social welfare.

        Specified by:
        setMinimizeDeviation in interface MechanismInterface
        Parameters:
        decomp_min_dev - set to true to minimize the deviation.

      • step1SolveLp

        public void step1SolveLp()
        Step 1: Solve the LP, e.g. using Gurobi.

        If this step was performed before it will just output the saved solution.

      • step2SolveDual

        public void step2SolveDual()
        Step 2: Solve the dual of the convex decomposition using the ellipsoid method with central cut as default.

      • step2SolveDual

        public void step2SolveDual(int cut)
        Step 2: Solve the dual of the convex decomposition using the ellipsoid method with specified cut.

        This method will import the LP result from step 1, initialize the oracle and the primal of the decomposition, set all parameters and finally start the ellipsoid method. In the end it will output all found integer solutions and some statistics.

        Parameters:
        cut - ellipsoid cut.
        See Also:
        EllipsoidMethod.CUT_CENTRAL, EllipsoidMethod.CUT_DEEP, EllipsoidMethod.CUT_SHALLOW

      • step3SolvePrimal

        public void step3SolvePrimal()
        Step 3: Solve the primal of the convex decomposition using any solver, e.g. Gurobi.

        This method will validate that the optimal social welfare divided by the integrality gap equals the expected social welfare of all integer solutions calculated after the primal is solved.

        See Also:
        PrimalDecomposition.getExpectedSocialWelfare()

      • printAnalysis

        public void printAnalysis()
        Prints some analysis data from the special AnalysisHelper.

      • runMechanism

        public void runMechanism()
        Runs one iteration of the framework for previously defined parameters.

        This method initializes the AnalysisHelper, creates the oracle, runs all steps in order and saves the result as files.

        Specified by:
        runMechanism in interface MechanismInterface

      • solveLpIntegral

        public void solveLpIntegral()
        Solves the LP without relaxation to compare the integral solution with the relaxed solution.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
